titles.title: To designate the United States courthouse at South Federal Place in Santa Fe, New Mexico, as the "Santiago E. Campos United States Courthouse".

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E133)
Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic Development, Public Buildings and Emergency Management.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote .
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Transportation. H. Rept. 110-18.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 12.

action.text: Ms. Norton moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 544.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Received in the Senate, read twice.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E494-495)

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary:
3/21/2007--Public Law. (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)
Designates the U.S. courthouse located at South Federal Place in Santa Fe, New Mexico, as the "Santiago E. Campos United States Courthouse."
